p: P. cubeba, or tailed pepper, a plant originated from Java and Borneo, sometimes called as Java pepper, is mostly cultivated for its berries and essential oil [ 12]. Normally, this plant is utilized as a traditional medicine to treat gonorrhea, dysentery, syphilis, abdominal pain, diarrhea, enteritis, and asthma diseases [ 13]. Some biological activities of P. cubeba EO for instance antiparasitic [ 14], antimicrobial [ 15], insecticidal activities [ 16] have been reported. Sabinene, Î²-elemene, and cubebol are the principal components of P. cubeba EO extracted from its berries [ 17].
